thread.title: Have a Loukoumades Feast at Gre.co, Opening Imminently in Back Bay
thread.title_full: Have a Loukoumades Feast at Gre.co, Opening Imminently in Back Bay

author: Rachel Leah Blumenthal
title: Have a Loukoumades Feast at Gre.co, Opening Imminently in Back Bay
text: Eater Inside Have a Loukoumades Feast at Gre.co, Opening Imminently in Back Bay Here’s a peek inside the new fast-casual spot on Newbury Street, set to open by the end of January share By the end of the month, Newbury Street will be filled with the sweet smell of fried dough, courtesy of Gre.co. The fast-casual Greek restaurant, opening in the former Scissors & Pie space at 225 Newbury St., comes from Committee’s Demetri Tsolakis, as previously reported . It prominently features Greece’s take on doughnut holes — light, crispy balls of fried dough called loukoumades , available at Gre.co with a variety of toppings, from crushed Oreos to pistachios. Also on the menu: gyros; customizable pitas, salads, and plates with a variety of fillings and toppings; fries with feta; zucchini chips; avgolemono soup; and a range of soft drinks, including Greek-style iced coffee (frappes), ouzo-flavored soda, and more. Plus, there’s a retail shelf with some specialty food items from Greece, along with Gre.co’s stuffed mascot, Tasos. Classic gyro Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater Cretan salad Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater Classic loukoumades (Greek honey, walnuts, cinnamon) Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater Yaya’s loukoumades (hazelnut praline, Oreos, powdered sugar) Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater Gre.co will be open daily from 11 a.m. to 10 p.m.; keep an eye on social media for an announcement of the exact opening date, most likely early next week. Opening day will include free loukoumades.
